channel.title: News API
channel.description: RSS feed based on news api response

item.title: US deal with Russia on Syria will save 'tremendous numbers of lives': Trump
item.description: Donald Trump says an agreement with Russian President Vladimir Putin on Syria would save many lives.

item.title: Ellyse Perry stars for Australia with record knock against England
item.description: Ellyse Perry breaks the Australian women's Test record for the highest score, smashing an unbeaten 213 against England in their day-night Women's Ashes encounter at North Sydney Oval.

item.title: Queensland Premier rubbishes One Nation's claims schoolchildren taught masturbation
item.description: Queensland Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk slaps down One Nation's claims that teachers are showing children sex tricks in the classroom as untrue.

item.title: John Alexander resigns amid deepening citizenship crisis for Government
item.description: Federal Liberal MP John Alexander has become the latest victim of the citizenship scandal, resigning after reaching the conclusion he can not be certain he is not a dual citizen.

item.title: Trawler Dianne survivor Ruben McDornan speaks of heartbreak over lost mates
item.description: The sole survivor of a trawler that capsized off the Queensland coast opens up publicly for the first time, posting an emotional tribute to his six lost crewmates on social media.

item.title: Tonga upsets New Zealand in Rugby League World Cup boilover
item.description: Tonga creates Rugby League World Cup history with a stunning 28-22 victory over giants New Zealand.

item.title: 'Fundamental agreement' reached on rebadged TPP deal
item.description: Eleven Pacific Rim countries reach agreement on continuing with a free trade pact after the US abandons it.

item.title: One Nation, Jacqui Lambie eye off Tasmanian election
item.description: Pauline Hanson and Jacqui Lambie could run candidates in the next Tasmanian election, as incumbents warn against negative campaigning.

item.title: Three lawyers charged in probe into suspected criminal activity in Qld
item.description: Three Brisbane lawyers are charged with aggravated fraud after a joint Queensland police and CCC investigation into suspected criminal activity within elements of the legal profession.

item.title: Despite the 0-0, it finally clicks for Ange's Socceroos in their best away performance
item.description: It was frustrating, and there's still some work to do, but the Socceroos produce arguably their best performance on the road in some time in the 0-0 first-leg draw with Honduras.
